intro: Thesium costatum var. paniculatum, commonly known as the panicled thesium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in paniculate inflorescences, which are often borne on slender stems. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Thesium costatum var. paniculatum is often found in moist, acidic soils in forested or rocky habitats.
